title: (x) Brand New blog's sweet slab - Apex Serif {Akira}
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821153905im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/brand_new_header_left-over_3541.gif)

 [‹ (x) Tagline on John Carpenter's "Christine" movie poster - Albertus {Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821153905/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40859 "Go to previous forum topic") [\*\*\*\*\*\*WHAT IS THIS TYPE FACE?\*\*\*\*\*\* ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821153905/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40858 "Go to next forum topic")
author: roquestrew

comments.content:
You’re good; never woulda thought of the small caps!

Many thanks!

You’re welcome.

But I’ve just remembered [this one](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821153905/http:/www.myfonts.com/WhatTheFont/forum/viewthread.php?threadid=101400). metro2005 is good, not me.

To be honest, I don’t think it’s so “sweet”. The ’B’ is awkward and the [counters](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821153905/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/counter) are clogged, evidence of mechanical extrapolation to make the heavy weights, rather than redrawing. This is not Chester’s best work. I’m hoping he updates it [like he did Apex Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821153905/http:/www.vllg.com/Thirstype/ApexNew/Example+About/).
People seem to like clogged counters these days! :^D
It’s true. If he were a less genuine fellow, Chester could claim he anticipated the trend by several years.
It’s that exact idiosyncrasy I find sweet, actually; I wouldn’t dare use this outside the awkward-pasty-indie-rock concert poster subgenre
